summary: Syntax file for the Kid templating language
name: kid.vim
description: Kid (http://kid.lesscode.org/) is a attribute-based xml templating language written in Python. This syntax file covers the language as documented in the language specification. The gzipped tarball also contains a kid ftplugin, for gvim integration and a kid ftdetect plugin so that vim highlights the file as kid rather than xml/xhtml.
install_details:
Extract the file in your home directory. The three scripts are extracted to:
./.vim/ftdetect/kid.vim
../vim/ftplugin/kid.vim
./.vim/syntax/kid.vim
